page.title: 03Hill End near Twyning
page.content: Hill End, between Strensham and Twyning, has about 40 scattered houses. All are more than four years old, one is thatched and eight were built by the council. There is a small village green, with a telephone kiosk and pillar box. There is no shop, but a bus runs to Tewkesbury twice a week. Hill End Common is unfenced area of 11 acres. A farm produces eggs for a hatchery. A nursery man owns three acres of land, a third of which is covered by oil heated glass and polythene houses. Salad vegetables and bedding plants are grown from seed. The produce is collected and sold in Hereford. A market gardener owns 22 acres and grows vegetables which are started under glass. He sells lettuce at Xmas and takes his produce to market at Cheltenham.
